songs.full_title: The Addams Family by Andrew Gold
songs.title: The Addams Family

description.plain:
Written and arranged by veteran TV composer Vic Mizzy, “The Addams Family” was the theme song to the 1964 sitcom of the same name, itself based on the work of comic artist Charles Addams.

As with many of Mizzy’s TV themes, “The Addams Family” theme song got its own single, but it did not reach the national charts.

The song was also used in the 1977 reunion special, the feature film “The Addams Family” and its sequel “The Addams Family Values,” the 1992 animated series, and the stage musical.

[Bridge]

[Verse 2]
So put a witch's shawl on

We're gonna pay a call on

They're creepy and they're kooky

Strange

The Addams family1Embed

songs.full_title: Spooky Scary Skeletons by Andrew Gold
songs.title: Spooky Scary Skeletons

description.plain: The song is about the clashing contrast between the scary appearance of skeletons that cause people to run away and their desire to communicate with humans. This features two narrators, the first that speaks folk tales of their spooky demeanor and the other that sympathizes with the skeletons, trying to dismiss their misunderstood intent and frightening aura.

songs.full_title: Spooky Scary Skeletons (Remix) by The Living Tombstone
songs.title: Spooky Scary Skeletons (Remix)

songs.lyrics:
50 ContributorsSpooky Scary Skeletons Lyrics[Verse 1]
Spooky, scary skeletons send shivers down your spine
Shrieking skulls will shock your soul, seal your doom tonight
Spooky, scary skeletons speak with such a screech
You'll shake and shudder in surprise when you hear these zombies shriek

[Interlude]
We're so sorry skeletons, you're so misunderstood
You only want to socialize (But I don't think we should)

[Verse 2]
'Cause spooky, scary skeletons shout startling, shrilly screams
They'll sneak from their sarcophagus and just won't leave you be

[Chorus]
Ah, ah, ah, eh
Ah, hurr

[Interlude]
Spirits, supernatural are shy, what's all the fuss?
But bags of bones seem so unsafe, it's semi-serious!

[Verse 3]
Spooky, scary skeletons are silly all the same
They'll smile and scrabble slowly by and drive you so insane!
Sticks and stones will break your bones, they seldom let you snooze
Spooky, scary skeletons will wake you with a boo!You might also like29Embed

songs.full_title: Thank You for Being a Friend by Andrew Gold
songs.title: Thank You for Being a Friend
songs.title_with_featured: Thank You for Being a Friend

description.plain:
Most notable for being the theme song on the Golden Girls sitcom, the song was sung by The Golden Girls themselves: Bea Arthur, Betty White, Rue McClanahan and Estelle Getty.

The song embraces the concept of a strong friendship and expresses the gratitude of this friendliness in the title.

songs.lyrics:
14 ContributorsThank You for Being a Friend LyricsThank you for being a friend
Traveled down the road and back again
Your heart is true
You're a pal and a confidant

I'm not ashamed to say
I hope it always will stay this way
My hat is off
Won't you stand up and take a bow

And if you threw a party
Invited everyone you knew
You would see
The biggest gift would be from me
And the card attached would say
"Thank you for being a friend."

Thank you for being a friend
Thank you for being a friend
Thank you for being a friend

My hat is off

And when we both get older

I will stand real close and say

(I want to thank you)
